replies.bodyText:
Not really.
Publishing a patch to a channel can happen either when the patch has never been published before (unpublished, the case we are removing with this PR and its sister #2280) or when the errata was already published - just in a different channel. The second use case is not expected to go away - and it's actually essential to CLM, for example, when promoting content from a channel (say "test") to another (say "production").
We could come up with another word, but I think publish still makes sense, and in so doing we don't break existing scripts, documentation, etc.

timeline.message:
rhn-clone-errata: drop

This is a script to clone errata from the Red Hat Network API, which has
long been dropped.
ErrataHandler.create: remove flag to create unpublished errata

ErrataHandler.publish*: clarify documentation

Contrary to what was documented, these methods work equally well on
published an unpublished errata.

OvalServlet: do not return unpublished errata

ErrataFactory.lookupByAdvisoryId is only called by
ErrataFactory.lookupByIdentifier which is only called by
ErrataManager.lookupErrataByIdentifier which is only called by
OvalServlet.doGet

Bugfix: prevent unpublished errata from being scheduled to apply

ErrataFactory.listErrata is only called by
ErrataManager.lookupErrataByIds which is only called by
ErrataManager.applyErrata which is ultimately called by
 - call sites which only used published errata as input:
   - the single-system errata apply page (which implicitly checked via the UI data flow)
   - the SSM errata apply page (which implicitly checked via the UI data flow)
   - the package push page (which implicitly checked via the UI data flow)
   - the errata notification page (which explicitly checked)
   - the errata to channel assignment page (which explicitly checked)
   - ActionManager.scheduleAllErrataUpdate (which only used published errata)
   - SystemManager.setAutoUpdateBulk (which only used published errata)
   - ErrataManager.updateStackUpdateNeeded (which only used published errata)
   - ChannelSoftwareHandler.syncErrata (which explicitly checked)

 - call sites which did not check whether input included unpublished
errata, and are being fixed by this commit:
   - ActionChainHandler.addErrataUpdate
   - ServerGroupHandler.scheduleApplyErrataToActive
   - SystemHandler.scheduleApplyErrata
   - the page listing systems affected by an errata

 - call sites that are actually broken by this patch
   - pages to list/add/remove packages, bugs, channels other details to an errata.
Doing such edits to an unpublished errata will not work at this time,
unpublished errata will need filtering
   - the is_published_errata JSP ACL. Pages using that ACL will not work
Fix JUnit tests after disabling of unpublished errata
